info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 21 at 7:30PM CDT until March 21 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL MILAM AND CENTRAL FALLS COUNTIES... At 729 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Rosebud, or 16 miles north of Cameron, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Weather spotters reported a funnel cloud. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Lott around 740 PM CDT. Marlin around 755 PM CDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter now! Get to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building and avoid windows.
